content.description: First bolt is 20 feet high at the right side of the roof (i'm giving it an R rating because of the high first bolt, it was too high to even stick clip without climbing a few feet up first).  Route begins on the unique "tapeworm" formation to the ledge below the first bolt then goes right and up for the rest of the route.
content.location: Bouldery start on a unique "tapeworm" shaped formation across from a lounge boulder to the right of Monkey Pajamas.

content.description: Climb up to a dirty/mossy ledge, through a dihedral, then do a small bouldery, bulgy section to your left, and then head up to the cool flake thing sticking out that's about 3 feet wide. Go up and right then do a huge move to a roof pull, can clip anchors from the last jug under the anchors.
content.location: Under a large roof section is the infamous pile of broken glass and beer cans. While standing in this pile (hopefully with shoes on) look straight up at the wall and look for a zig-zaggy, beautiful line.

content.description: Great Route, but it may need cleaning.
content.location: On the face left of Monkey Pajamas where tree goes close to the wall.

content.description: This is the left-most route on the wall, going directly up the arête. A great mini-roof warmup route if you plan to tackle some of the 5.12s at Landfill. Start on the low slab and make some tricky movement to clip the 2nd bolt. Then hold on for a couple moves through the awesome mini-roofing jugs to pull to anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 old school sport bolts at the top.
content.location: From the far side of Landfill Wall, continue past Slopeamine on the trail going left and follow it around the corner on a slightly overgrown trail (covered in poison ivy in summer). Eventually you will reach an arête on the right which contains two isolated routes, Pika Peak and Dos Vatos.

content.description: Consider a stick clip for first bolt. Do crux move or two getting past first bolt, stay in dihedral, clip second bolt (kind of a reachy clip), then climb to anchor. Pumpy short upper section overhangs quite a bit. Decent but not great anchor. Anchor does not have sport clips as of 2/2017.   PG rating is for potential 'wrecking ball' fall if from above bolt 2.
content.protection: 2 lead bolts w/hangers. Two anchor bolts - one is bolt thru chain, other is bolt w/hanger and one quick link.
content.location: A shallow dihedral that transitions right into three stepped overhangs. Wall faces north, is under overhang, and was shaded all day in early February - might be shaded all day in summer?

content.description: Start at a low roof and up onto a dirty ledge.  Climb through some very featured rock, left of a tufa, and through the roof.  Great climbing other than the dirt covered ledge.
content.location: To the left of where the trail meets the wall.  Starts at a 5' high roof, just right of a big bush on the ledge.  1st bolt is above the ledge, 2nd bolt is a couple feet above the 1st.

content.description: Bolt one is high over the handhold ledge. The guidebook doesn't describe the actual start to the climb, i.e. direct below the bolt or traversing in on the handhold ledge. I traversed in on the ledge and feel like that's the most logical way to start, grade felt solid too this way.Once you get above the ledge clip bolt 2, then execute some techy face climbing to get to, and clip bolt 3. A runout to the anchors follows, with a collection of bad holds, a massive jug flake, pockets, and finally the lip of the cliff which makes for a massive clipping jug.
content.location: Right of the arete at the right side of the Landfill wall amphitheatre.

content.description: Start as for "Sometimes I'm Dreamin'", but at the starting ledge go left to clip the first bolt. Trend up and slightly left encountering a roof with some cruxy moves to the chains.
content.location: Anchors left of Sometimes I'm Dreamin'

content.description: Access the high starting ledge from the large boulder on the ground. Follow excellent movement up the short headwall before transitioning into a large roof.
content.location: One route right of Sometimes I’m Dreamin’.

content.description: While more difficult than its counterpart to the left, this route has smaller roof holds but is more straight forward getting to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, old school sport bolt anchors.
content.location: This route is directly right of Pika Peak. Continue to the left past Slopeamine through some mild seasonably dependent bushwhacking to eventually find these 2 hidden gems all by themselves before the wall turns a corner and exits to the trails above.

content.description: This is the first area you reach when crossing to the south side.  This wall is clearly less climbed and at parts slightly overgrown, yet it offers shade and awesome routes.  It mostly contains routes in the 5.10 range.  As you walk up from the creek, Jugfest (5.8) is one of the first routes you will find located on a huge tufa.
